content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the solution in Julia using DataFrames.jl package:
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.year.(df.dt)*100 .+ Dates.month.(df.dt)
end
```
The function `add_yearmonth` accepts a dataframe as an argument and adds a new column `ym` to it. This column is filled with the year and month from each entry in the DateTime column `dt`. The `.` operator is used on the `Dates` module to get the year (`year`) or the month (`month`) of a DateTime object. The resulting values are concatenated into the format "yyyymm".
